data.title: Edmund White
data.meta_description: Edmund White is an American writer whose books include The Joy of Gay Sex (1977) (written with Charles Silverstein) and his trio of autobiographic novels: A Boy's Own Story (1982), The Beautiful Room Is Empty (1988) and The Farewell Symphony (1997). His most recent work is Jack Holmes and His Friend (2012)
data.text:
Stonewall at 50

White men were first to benefit from gay liberation – but it can't end there

Edmund White

Fifty years ago, Edmund White witnessed the Stonewall riots. Here, he pays homage to the LGBT people of color, drag queens and tough kids of Harlem who paved the way to freedom

‘At last I felt I fitted in’: writers on the books that helped them come out

Sarah Waters, Edmund White, Jeanette Winterson, Jackie Kay – 50 years after the decriminalisation of homosexuality, writers recall the books that first spoke to them of their lives and longings

Edmund White: 'I try to be honest. If I lose someone's friendship, so what?'

Why a memoirist’s contract with a reader is to tell the truth, and nothing but the truth

Others had used magic realism. García Márquez made the technique his own

Edmund White

Edmund White: The genius of Gabriel García Márquez, who has died aged 87, was to purify his style into a simplicity that was accessible to everyone
